abstract: China Mobile, the world’s largest mobile carrier, said it will pay $5.8 billion for 20 percent of Shanghai Pudong Development Bank and will jointly develop mobile finance and e-commerce businesses with the bank, Reuters reported.
snippet: China Mobile, the world’s largest mobile carrier, said it will pay $5.8 billion for 20 percent of Shanghai Pudong Development Bank and will jointly develop mobile finance and e-commerce businesses with the bank, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: China Mobile, the world’s largest mobile carrier, said it would pay $5.8 billion for 20 percent of Shanghai Pudong Development Bank and would jointly develop mobile finance and e-commerce businesses with the bank, Reuters reported.

headline.main: China Mobile Puts $5.8 Billion Into Pudong Bank
